title: Add Interactive Demo Request / Booking Form

requirements.text: Add a 'Schedule a Demo' booking form section to the page. The form should collect the visitor's full name, work email address, company name, team size (dropdown: 1–10, 11–50, 51–200, 200+), and a preferred contact time (text or dropdown). Include a 'Book My Demo' submit button. On successful submission, display an inline confirmation message such as 'Thanks! A member of our team will reach out shortly to confirm your demo.' The form should be accessible via the 'Schedule a Demo' button in the CTA section (smooth scroll) and linked from the navbar.
acceptanceCriteria: A visible 'Schedule a Demo' form section exists on the page with fields: full name, work email, company name, team size (dropdown), and preferred contact time.
All fields are validated client-side before submission (required fields, valid email format).
On successful submission, an inline success message is shown without a page reload.
The 'Schedule a Demo' button in the CTA section smooth-scrolls to this form.
The form section is included in the navbar navigation links.
The form handles loading and error states gracefully.

requirements.text: Store demo booking submissions in the Motoko backend. Add a `DemoRequest` record type with fields: name (Text), email (Text), company (Text), teamSize (Text), preferredTime (Text), and submittedAt (Int timestamp). Expose a `submitDemoRequest` update method that validates the email is non-empty and stores the record, and a `getAllDemoRequests` query method that returns all stored requests.
acceptanceCriteria: A `DemoRequest` stable variable exists in the backend actor to persist demo requests across upgrades.
`submitDemoRequest` accepts all required fields, validates that email and name are non-empty, and stores the record with a timestamp.
`getAllDemoRequests` returns the full list of stored demo requests.
The frontend demo form successfully calls `submitDemoRequest` and receives a confirmation response.

requirements.text: Add a React Query mutation hook `useSubmitDemoRequest` in `frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts` that calls the backend `submitDemoRequest` method, mirroring the existing `useCaptureEmail` pattern.
acceptanceCriteria: `useSubmitDemoRequest` mutation hook is defined and exported from useQueries.ts.
The hook calls the backend actor's `submitDemoRequest` method with all required parameters.
The hook exposes loading, error, and success states that the demo form component can consume.

constraints: Do not modify any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths.
All backend logic must remain in the single main actor (backend/main.mo).
Preserve all existing sections, styling, and functionality of the marketing site.
nonGoals: Calendar integration or automated scheduling (e.g., Calendly).
Email sending or automated follow-up notifications.
Authentication or user accounts for demo bookers.
Monetisation strategy implementation — this is out of scope for the build.
